seg.seg: (the fourth [is, he obtains] students), and the fifth is for him the advantage of obtaining property beyond [that]. Of the household and of the gods'
world, skill is the root. Therefore it has been said by great teachers: || In the Ś.-Tune:|| [It is] Skill
Fertigkeit soll man zuerst erlangen, dann soll man Besitztümer sammeln.
Skill one shall acquire first, then one shall gather possessions.
[that] one must acquire first, then one must gather possessions; the gathered possessions, however, one must always divided into four parts:

Die gesammelten Besitztümer aber soll man stets viermal teilen: Einen Teil soll man im Haus[halt] genießen, mit zweien soll man Gewerbe betreiben [und] mit Rücksicht auf spätere Not[zeiten] [wtl. für später Not erblickt habend] soll man den vierten gut bewahren.

The possessions gathered one should always divide in four parts: one part one shall enjoy in the house, with two [parts] one shall conduct trade, [and] having foreseen [times of] need later, one should keep the fourth [part] well.
one part shall be enjoyed in the house, with two an activity/trade shall be pursued; with regard to times of need, one should well preserve the fourth one.
1. One activity is (providing) water to the earth, a second is tending the livestock, a third one is trade, a fourth one is increasing the livestock, a fifth --
--, a sixth is conservation. Whoever in his household has connected these six, and by division (gathers) possession in a five(fold way,)
this one’s trade goes right and well. 2. Possessions that are gathered in that way by day and night increase like ... or like ...
Besitztümer, die so gesammelt werden, wachsen bei Tag [und] Nacht wie ...
Possessions that are gathered thus, grow by night [and] day like ...
[but] one shall not keep possession for old age, not for those standing above the land, not for the cruel
and evil ones, and neither for the powerful ones. 3. At all times he shall do only the thing one should do, never let him do the thing one should not do;
Man tue immer nur das, was man tun soll, nicht tue man das, was man nicht tun soll: Denn der Mensch, der das tut, was man tun soll, leuchtet wie glühendes Feuer.
One should only ever do a thing to be done, never should one do a thing not to be done: for the person who does a thing to be done shines like a glowing fire.
for the being who does the thing one should do shines like a glowing fire. By his own relatives and friends
... received in the beginning [and] at the end, he roars in the midst of all his followers, confident as a bull [in the midst of his herd]. 4. After having given and received gift[s],

[After] having given and received gift[s], as it is proper, a being [is] equal to all: if it comes in the reach of death, it attains the dwelling of the gods through its flawless perfection. (cf 7; 241)
as it is proper, a being [is] equal to all: if it comes in the reach of death, it attains the dwelling of the gods (through its flawless perfection).
